intro: Zephyranthes steyermarkii, commonly known as the Mexican rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in response to rainfall. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. It produces small, strap-like leaves and has a short rhizomatous stem. Zephyranthes steyermarkii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
